Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Binding redirect update" (#10169) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Adding binding redirect for `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection` following the version bump in shims library. Without it, Gallery fails on the first auditing call.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Binding redirect update" (#10169) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Adding binding redirect for `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection` following the version bump in shims library. Without it, Gallery fails on the first auditing call.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: email - password login doesn't work anymore." (#10167) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

The login page doesn't have the email-password login anymore, the page for email-password also doesn't work.    
I cannot connect to my nuget.org account anymore since it doesn't use a microsoft login.  

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a0f2840-b3eb-4caa-b7cb-203010737ee0)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/01be17b4-e7f3-4481-bc73-a3db0a9b8b74)

Because of this I cannot migrate my account to a microsoft login.

### Repro Steps

N/A

### Expected Behavior

N/A

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

when using NuGet.org I am signing using Azure Trusted Signing the certificate.

I extract the certificate using normal tools, and upload the CER file

The upload validation fails saying there isn't a certificate of the SHA256 found. Even though the certificate uploaded now has a valid name listed against it (which it wasn't previously)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c020a600-19b2-44ba-ac98-42c88f0e2f41)

I check the SHA256 and it matches using the algorithm mentioned (I would provide a screenshot

I am used the cli sign with ATS support, signtool, and jsign

Also NuGet package explorer lists it as a valid certificate 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cdff6d7f-7c15-4c16-9135-c90733ab472f)

I wouldn't be shocked if there is some certificate issue that nuget.org doesn't like and its showing that generic error message?

This used to be a dotnetfoundation owned package (removed the ownership so I can test ATS for the foundation), and DNF has special rules around signing certificate lockouts so not sure if that has something to do with it?

the package name is `Splat`

### Repro Steps

1. Sign a package with ATS
2. Extract the package using certificate extraction tools
3. Upload the CER files
4. Upload the NuGet package.

### Expected Behavior

That when you upload the valid CER file, and have it listed that it 

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Read package icon from local folders when remote feed (upstream) cannot access metadata" (#13766) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Current Behavior

As identified in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9250, on the Browse tab, when search results come from an upstream source in an Azure DevOps feed the package icon may be inaccessible.

### Desired Behavior

If the package already exists in the global packages folder or other local folder on the machine, load the icon from there rather than show the default icon.

### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Behavior Change] Upgrade missing README warning to and error if <NuGetRequireReadMe> is true" (#13765) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet SDK

### Current Behavior

When packing a NuGet project, we warn if a README is missing.

### Desired Behavior

When packing a NuGet project and a project specifies <NuGetRequireReadMe>, we should upgrade to an error if a README is missing.

### Additional Context

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu5039

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature] Provide a MSBuild property that can generate a markdown file with MSBuild." (#13764) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

If a project has a property such as `<PackageReadMeContents>...</PackageReadMeContents>` which contained valid markdown, MSBuild could potentially create a README.md on behalf of the project and drop it in the root of the .nupkg if people prefer flexibility in providing a README.md.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Report the path when unable to read corrupted .nupkg.metadata " (#13763) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Pick a .nupkg.metadata file from your package cache and replace the contents with some NULL bytes, or corrupt it otherwise
Use RestoreEx that reads that file

Expected: nice error message `The file 'C:\Users\user\.nuget\packages\microsoft.win32.systemevents\8.0.0\.nupkg.metadata' is corrupted. It is recommended to clear the package cache using dotnet nuget locals all --clear and then retry the restore.`

Actual: 
```
d:\Current\bin\amd64\NuGet.RestoreEx.targets(19,5): error : Found invalid data while decoding. [D:\git\move\temp-msbuild-restore\dirs.proj]
d:\Current\bin\amd64\NuGet.RestoreEx.targets(19,5): error :    at NuGet.Packaging.NupkgMetadataFileFormat.Read(TextReader reader, ILogger log, String path) [D:\git\move\temp-msbuild-restore\dirs.proj]
d:\Current\bin\amd64\NuGet.RestoreEx.targets(19,5): error :    at NuGet.Packaging.NupkgMetadataFileFormat.Read(Stream stream, ILogger log, String path) [D:\git\move\temp-msbuild-restore\dirs.proj]
d:\Current\bin\amd64\NuGet.RestoreEx.targets(19,5): error :    at NuGet.Common.FileUtility.SafeRead[T](String filePath, Func`3 read) [D:\git\move\temp-msbuild-restore\dirs.proj]
```

See also:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4660
https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10882

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error reports of invalid or missing transitive NuGet dependencies are unusable" (#13715) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Error-reports-of-invalid-or-missing-tran/10723823)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work] [regression] [worked-in:17.12 Preview 1]
It's great that Visual Studio tells me that it can't resolve a package, but there are no actions that can be taken and no report of where the transitive dependency comes from.

It would be great if when I clicked on the error in the error log in Visual Studio if it took me directly to the package that has the missing transitive dependency

---
### Original Comments

#### Feedback Bot on 8/15/2024, 06:22 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fetch transitive packages for all PM UI levels" (#13695) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: In its simplified form, this involves removing the IsSolution checks for code that queries for transitive packages and adjusting the code to handle the Solution-level PM UI scenarios.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Transitive's in Solution PM UI] Update vulnerability warning indicators" (#13762) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Update the tooltip for the vulnerability warning indicator in the package list to provide more details about which versions specifically are vulnerable. (stretch goal)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Transitive's in Solution PM UI] Update the tooltip for packages to show transitive origins" (#13761) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Update the tooltip creation code so a package that is both top-level and transitive shows the transitive origin details.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Transitive's in Solution PM UI] Get vulnerability info for all the installed versions" (#13760) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: PackageItemViewModel will iterate over the list of installedVersions and get vulnerability info from the audit database for each of the versions which will determine if the package is vulnerable in the package list.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Transitive's in Solution PM UI] Combine all packages metadata into a PackageItemViewModel" (#13759) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: PackageItemLoader will handle combining the package with all its versions into a single PackageItemViewModel with a list of installedVersions.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Transitive's in Solution PM UI] InstalledAndTransitivePackageFeed should know the metadata for all the packages" (#13758) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Change how InstalledAndTransitivePackageFeed deduplicates each of the top-level and transitive packages with GetLatest and gets the metadata for said package.
-- Make it get metadata only for the latest, but return all of the packages

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet add package with CPM installs a different version than what gets restored" (#13657) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

8.0.7

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1) Create in a empty folder the file the `Directory.Packages.props` to Package Management specify `Azure.Identity@1.10.3` :
```xml
<Project>
  <PropertyGroup>
    <ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>true</ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageVersion Include="Azure.Identity" Version="1.10.3" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

2) Create a project with the package `Azure.Identity` without specify the version and audit it :
```
dotnet new console -n ConsoleApp1
dotnet add ConsoleApp1 package Azure.Identity
dotnet list ConsoleApp1 package --vulnerable
```

The audit show no vulnerability :
```
The given project `ConsoleApp1` has no vulnerable packages given the current sources.
```

3) Restore the project and reaudit it :
```
dotnet restore ConsoleApp1
dotnet list ConsoleApp1 package --vulnerable
```

The audit show the expected vulnerabilities :
```
Project `ConsoleApp1` has the following vulnerable packages
   [net8.0]:
   Top-level Package      Requested   Resolved   Severity   Advisory URL
   > Azure.Identity       1.10.3      1.10.3     Moderate   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wvxc-855f-jvrv
                                                 Moderate   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m5vv-6r4h-3vj9
```

---

Without CPM, the audit work without restore :
```
dotnet new console -n ConsoleApp1
dotnet add ConsoleApp1 package Azure.Identity --version 1.10.3
dotnet list ConsoleApp1 package --vulnerable
```

So the audit show the expected vulnerabilities :
```
Project `ConsoleApp1` has the following vulnerable packages
   [net8.0]:
   Top-level Package      Requested   Resolved   Severity      Advisory URL
   > Azure.Identity        1.10.3          1.10.3       Moderate   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wvxc-855f-jvrv
                                                                        Moderate   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m5vv-6r4h-3vj9
```

---

I expect the audit work without a explicit restore.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet returns 10 result on search but doesn't indiacate that." (#13757) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### The Elevator Pitch

Paging indicator that NuGet found some result but show only 10 of them like 10/145. This may cause missing opportunity of other packages when they are not listed on first 10.

### Additional Context and Details

Visual proof of NuGet doesn't have any indicator.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2b945033-01f4-40ed-8428-0a2b7656bc88)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
